bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alice Forbes, January 6, 1942

div1.p: Hench would like to meet with Alice Forbes, Wallace Forbes' mother.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Alice Forbes, January 6, 1942
div1.opener:
Mother of Wallace Wellington Forbes
January 6, 1942
Mrs. Alice Forbes
5450 Walton Street
Chicago, Illinois
My dear Mrs. Forbes:
div1.p:
I am sending you a reprint on the conquest of yellow fever which
I gave as an address when Mr. Cornwell's painting was unveiled last year by
Dr. Walter Reed's daughter. I am making a special study of this story and
hope to publish a book on it. I am anxious to learn as much as I can about
each of the American soldiers who volunteered. I am glad to learn your
address.

This Thursday I am going to New York and Washington and will be
returning through Chicago about January 21 or 22. I will be pleased to be
allowed to call on you. I know that you unfortunately do not know where
your son is. I have written to many of the survivors of the experiments
trying to find his address but none of them seems to know. Nevertheless,
I should be pleased to meet you if you would write to this address that it
would be convenient for you. If you have a telephone, would you please give
me your telephone number that I may call you on my arrival and find out
when it is convenient for me to see you.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
